WHO.label: Frontline – WHO template (6 cohorts)
WHO.notes: WHO cost template for Frontline FETP covering six cohorts. Amounts are total across six cohorts and are used to derive percentage shares by cost component.

components.description: Salaries and benefits for local staff (faculty and secretariat) dedicated to the programme, including trainers, convenors, mentors and administrators.
Salary and benefits for consultants, advisors and other external experts, including costs borne by external funders.
Purchase costs for desktop computers, laptops, projectors, printers and similar items for staff and faculty.
Software for data analysis, training delivery or general office use for staff and faculty.
Lease of office space and utilities such as electricity, water and internet used by FETP staff and faculty.
Trainee stipends, scholarships or other allowances.
Laptops, internet access and similar equipment provided to trainees.
Software licences provided directly to trainees.
Printing of training materials, manuals and other educational resources.
Organising training sessions, including venue hire, catering and other training event costs.
Travel for faculty, mentors and trainees within the country for training, outbreaks, meetings or conferences, including per diem, lodging and transport.
International travel for faculty, mentors and trainees for conferences, outbreaks and meetings, including per diem, lodging and transport.
Any other direct cost associated with the FETP.
Salaries for upper management who oversee programme operations but are not involved in day-to-day delivery.
General office maintenance that is not directly attributable to the programme but is necessary for operations.
In-kind salary costs for trainers, mentors and other support staff not directly charged to the programme.
Upgrading or maintaining facilities used by the programme.
Depreciation of high-value items such as computers and office furniture.
Shared utilities such as security, cleaning and shared internet access that benefit the wider organisation.
Legal and financial services, such as auditing, compliance checks and contract negotiations.
Training and development of staff members who are not direct trainees but support the programme.

components.subCategory: Trainee salary payments had they been employed
components.description: Value of trainee salary time while in training rather than in normal duties. Treated as economic (opportunity) cost.
Any other indirect cost associated with the FETP.

WHO.label: Intermediate – WHO template
WHO.notes: WHO cost template for Intermediate FETP. Amounts are total programme costs used to derive component shares.

components.description: Salaries and benefits for local staff dedicated to the intermediate programme.
Salary and benefits for consultants and advisors.
Office equipment for intermediate staff and faculty.
Software for intermediate programme staff and faculty.
Rent and utilities for office space used by intermediate programme staff.
Trainee stipends and allowances for the intermediate programme.
Laptops and other equipment for intermediate trainees.
Software licences for intermediate trainees.
Training materials and printing for intermediate cohorts.
Workshops and seminars for intermediate cohorts.
In-country travel for intermediate faculty, mentors and trainees.
International travel related to intermediate training and meetings.
Other direct costs for the intermediate programme.
Management and oversight for the intermediate programme.
Office maintenance that supports the intermediate programme.
In-kind salary contributions to the intermediate programme.
Facility upgrades that benefit the intermediate programme.
Depreciation of equipment used in the intermediate programme.
Shared utilities and services for the intermediate programme.
Legal and financial services for the intermediate programme.
Staff development for personnel who support intermediate training.

components.subCategory: Trainee salary payments had they been employed
components.description: Opportunity cost of trainee salary time (intermediate).
Other indirect costs for the intermediate programme.
